etymology.description: 一下 + 儿(兒) = brief/softened action.
etymology.interpretation: Placed after a verb to mean doing something briefly or lightly, often softening requests or commands. Common in northern Mandarin as erhua; functionally similar to 一下 without 儿.
etymology.simplification: 兒 was simplified to 儿 to reduce strokes and reflect the frequent colloquial suffix.

parts.english: once; a bit; briefly; for a moment
erhua/diminutive suffix; noun suffix; softening tone

examples.english: Please wait for me a moment.

examples.chinese: 老师，您看一下儿这个作业(老師，您看一下兒這個作業)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī, nín kàn yíxiàr zhège zuòyè.
examples.english: Teacher, please take a quick look at this homework.

examples.chinese: 我试一下儿就走(我試一下兒就走)。
examples.english: I’ll just try it briefly and then leave.
